summary: This is an email chain from May 2020 between federal prosecutors and law enforcement regarding the organization and tracking of FBI 302 interview reports and handwritten notes in the Epstein case. It reveals the scale of the investigation (over 120 interviews) and efforts to reconcile missing documents before trial.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting updates to the document tracker and noting over 120 interviews have been conducted in the case.

events.title: Document Review and Reconciliation
events.description: Prosecutors and law enforcement conduct a full review and cross-reference of all interview materials (302s and notes) in the Epstein case, identifying missing reports and notes.

keyFacts: The document reveals the investigation involved more than 120 interviews.
Prosecutors were actively reconciling FBI 302 reports with handwritten interview notes in preparation for trial.
There were discrepancies noted, including some interviews with notes but no 302s, and others with 302s but no notes.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and law enforcement agents to ensure all materials were properly tracked and organized.
The communication emphasizes the importance of organization to avoid issues during trial preparation.
